cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) because it deals with the task of lexical relation classification, which is a common problem in NLP. Additionally, the paper proposes a neural network model that uses BERT, a popular NLP model, and distant supervision to learn concept representations. 

The paper also involves meta-learning, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning (cs.AI) to improve the generalization ability of models. 

Furthermore, the paper uses a probabilistic distribution of auxiliary tasks to improve the model's ability to recognize different types of lexical relations, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG). 

The paper also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) since it deals with the task of identifying semantic relationships between concepts. 

Finally, the paper involves neural networks (cs.NE) since it proposes a neural network model for lexical relation classification.
